children.subject: <md>It depends on your interests, but I would not recommend taking Data 8 if you are taking CS 70 anyway -- Data 8 is a very cool class, but it is also rather qualitative and not hard to learn on your own, especially once you know a little probability. I have heard a faculty member insist that CS and EECS majors should never take Data 8 or Data 100 -- something along the lines of "it should be forbidden."</md>

history.content:
<md>CS 61B is a peaceful class -- there are some projects that take a little time.

CS 70 requires some work if you've never had any exposure to proofs before.

Data 8 is not much work at all.

I took 61B + 70 + 16B + some chemistry class one time, and it was tough but manageable. If you take any two of those three CS classes and then a couple of easy classes, you should have a peaceful life for that semester -- but of course, it varies widely depending on your background etc.</md>

EECS Major. Hoping to take these next semester. Have found 61A fairly (not super) easy so far, doing well. Definitely taking 61B next semester, and likely either 70 or 16B, but since there's been so much going on with 70, I think I just want to get it out of the way. Interested in Data classes, so want to take Data 8 ideally, unless these 3 are too much workload combined. Any advice / perspective?
history.subject: 61B + 70 + Data 8 Workload?
